message.content:
cs.NE, cs.ET, cs.AR, cs.AI, cs.SY

The paper discusses the implementation of spiking neural networks on neuromorphic hardware for solving constraint satisfaction problems. This topic falls under the intersection of several sub-fields of computer science, including neural networks (cs.NE), electronic circuits and systems (cs.ET), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and systems and control (cs.SY). Additionally, the paper presents a novel approach to achieving stochasticity in the neural network using subthreshold analog circuits affected by thermal noise, which could be of interest to researchers in the area of computer architecture (cs.AR).
